Proposed rezoning allows for taller buildings,

which will mandate the inclusion of affordable units

The Mandatory Inclusionary Housing requirement, set forth by the

New York City Council, outlines four options for rezoned districts.

Each option requires more affordable residential units as buildings get taller, priced relative to the area’s median income.

Affordable housing units before and after rezoning: 2810 Broadway Ave.

Residential unit

Affordable residential unit

Allowed by

current zoning

Allowed by

proposed rezoning

Currently built

The proposed

rezoning would allow

2810 Broadway Ave.

to be built taller,

activating the Mandatory

Inclusionary Housing

requirement for

affordable housing.

0 residential units

(0 affordable units)

102 residential units

(0 affordable units)

150 residential units

(38 affordable units)

Source: Morningside Heights Community Coalition, Council Member Mark Levine, Borough President Gale Brewer, Manhattan Community Board 9, and the City Council Land Use Division

Graphic by Mehr Kaur
